dialogues.text: Okay. That American friend of yours is still waiting for you. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  LONG SHOT вЂ”- THE STREET вЂ” FROM CALLOWAY'S EYE LINE Martins pacing on the far corner - looking up at the wind Tram passes LR.

dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  looks off wider CR for Martins paper still in hand. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” ANNA AND MARTINS CR of her. Kurtz moves downstage to stand between them fu face.

dialogues.text: Good evening, Miss Schmidt. Martins puts down his glass.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Good evening.

dialogues.speaker: KURTZ
dialogues.text: So, you have found out my little secret. A man must live. (to Martins) How goes the investigation? Have you proved to the police they are wrong? CLOSEUP вЂ” MARTINS looking off CL for Kurtz.

dialogues.text: Our friend Dr. Winkel said you had called. Wasn't he helpful? CLOSEUP вЂ” MARTINS past Kurtz in L f.g.

dialogues.text: The porter said three men carried the body - and two of them are here.

dialogues.text: from Martins' eye line some members of the International Patrol appear in the doorway to the bar. MED. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” ANNA AND MARTINS CR leaving on the bar. Behind them in the reflection of t wall mirror Martins watches the International Patrol as t enter bar. An American M.P. followed by a Russian enter f CL crossing screen behind Anna and Martin LR. As they go Martins turns back to the bar.

dialogues.text: Who are you looking for now?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Sssh. Don't. Don't, please.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: Silly looking bunch. MED. LONG SHOT вЂ” KURTZ followed by Popescu making their way through the tables a some members of the patrol CAMERA TRACKING BACK with them and PANNING RL revealing Anna and Martins at the bar in f They stop facing them - Kurtz CL. Kurtz introduces Popescu.

dialogues.speaker: KURTZ
dialogues.text: Mr. Popescu - Mr. Martins.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: How do you do.

dialogues.speaker: POPESCU
dialogues.text: Any friend of Harry's is a friend of mine.

dialogues.speaker: KURTZ
dialogues.text: I'll leave you together. Kurtz exits CR.

dialogues.speaker: POPESCU
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Good evening, Miss Schmidt. You remember me?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: POPESCU
dialogues.text: I helped Harry fix her papers, Mr. Martins...

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: Oh, you did.

dialogues.speaker: POPESCU
dialogues.text: Not the sort of thing I should confess to a total stranger, but you have to break the rules sometimes. Humanity's duty. He puts a cigarette in his mouth from a packet in his han and offers it to Anna.

dialogues.speaker: POPESCU
dialogues.text: Cigarette, Miss Schmidt?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: POPESCU
dialogues.text: Keep the packet. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” MARTINS past Popescu in L f.g.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: I understand you were with... CLOSE SHOT вЂ” POPESCU past Martins in R f.g.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: Harry...

dialogues.speaker: POPESCU
dialogues.text: Two double whiskeys. Was wunschen sie? He looks off CL for Anna.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Nichts danke. Kein.

dialogues.speaker: POPESCU
dialogues.text: Entschuldigen sie. It was a terrible thing. CLOSEUP вЂ” ANNA holding glass looking down thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: POPESCU, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: I was just crossing the road to go to Harry. MED. SHOT вЂ” POPESCU AND MARTINS crossing bar into restaurant. CAMERA PANNING AND TRACKING with them and revealing the almost empty tables beyond. T move upstage backs to camera, and stop in the center of t room.

dialogues.speaker: POPESCU
dialogues.text: He and the Baron were on the sidewalk. If I hadn't started to cross the road it wouldn't have happened. I can't help blaming myself and wishing things had been different. Anyway he saw me, and stepped off the sidewalk to meet me, and the truck...

dialogues.speaker: POPESCU
dialogues.text: past Martins in R f.g. Martins walks forward and stands C of him in L profile.

dialogues.speaker: POPESCU
dialogues.text: It was terrible, Mr. Martins вЂ” terrible. I have never seen a man killed before. He lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: I thought there was something funny about the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: POPESCU
dialogues.text: Funny?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Something wrong.

dialogues.speaker: POPESCU
dialogues.text: Of course there was. Some ice for Mr. Martins. A tray with two drinks comes into picture from CL and the each take one.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: You think so, too? Martins walks round Popescu RL.

dialogues.speaker: POPESCU
dialogues.text: It was so terrible for a man like Harry to be killed in an ordinary street accident. Martins is now CL of him in L f.g.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: That's all you meant?

dialogues.speaker: POPESCU
dialogues.text: What else? CLOSEUP вЂ” MARTINS past Popescu in R f.g. Music stops.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: Who was the third man? CLOSEUP вЂ” GLASS to his lips, lowers it smiling - past Martins in L f.g.

dialogues.speaker: POPESCU
dialogues.text: I oughtn't to drink it. It makes me acid. What man would you be referring to, Mr. Martins? CLOSEUP вЂ” MARTINS past Popescu in R f.g.

dialogues.text: I told you to go away, Martins. This isn't Santa Fe...I'm not a Sheriff, and you aren't a cowboy. You have been blundering around with the worst bunoh of racketeers in Vienna...your precious Harry's friends, and now you're wanted for murder. dialogues.text: I don't want another murder in this case, and you were born to be murdered. So you're going to hear the facts. MED. LONG SHOT вЂ” MARTINS Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  looking off CR for Calloway. He walks forward.

dialogues.text: Hmm, yes, yes. Joseph Harbin...medical orderly at the General Hospital. He used to work for Harry Lime. He turns away. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” MARTINS looking off CL for Calloway.

dialogues.text: Joseph Harbin? CLOSEUP вЂ” CALLOWAY past Official in L f.g. - he looks off CR at Martins. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.text: Ist das ihre pass? CLOSE SHOT вЂ” ANNA past Russian in R f.g., holding up her passport for her t

dialogues.text: Ja. CLOSE SHOT -вЂ” RUSSIAN past Anna in L f.g. He is holding up her passport.

dialogues.text: Bitte - siechen sie sick an... CLOSE SHOT вЂ” ANNA past Russian in R f.g. She turns away. LONG SHOT вЂ” ANNA in center of room. She picks up her clothes from back of MED. dialogues.speaker: LANDLADY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Was ist donn nun wieder les. Wird das so weiter gehen? Kommen sie jetz jeden tag zu uns? Was machen, denn die dadringen. CLOSE SHOT -вЂ” LANDLADY AND BRITISH SOLDIER of the Patrol, leaning against pillar CR of her. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.text: Kommen sie nicht rader ja nichten nichten nichten. Das kennen jeder. The solider ignoring her, moves away from the pillar and goes to door. She turns to call after him upstage.

dialogues.text: Rade sollen sie kommen sie nicht deutch? Die sprechen hatten sie schon langst lernen kommen. Large genug sind sie jat hier, jetz geht er. Was glotzen sie mich an? Habon sie nach nie einen turkey geschen? LONG SHOT вЂ” ANNA putting on her jacket, walks downstage past Russian soldi in L fВЈ.g. She exits CR and he turns to look after her.

dialogues.text: past Russian soldier who has turned round in L f.g. Anna moves to switch on light CR of American member of the pat standing in the window. Russian soldier crosses f.g. LR and Anna picks up her coa in b.g. and is helped on with it by American.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Where are you taking me?

dialogues.speaker: AMERICAN
dialogues.text: International Police Headquarters, just to check up. CLOSEUP вЂ” LANDLADY in doorway, looking off CL for Anna.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLADY
dialogues.text: Haben sie denn garne in shame... CLOSE SHOT вЂ” ANNA looking off CR for landlady.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLADY
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Un glaublich!

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN
dialogues.text: Bernigen sie sich sind sie fertig fraulein?

dialogues.text: looking off CL for Anna, who enters from CL.

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH SOLDIER
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Miss, it's orders. We can't go against the Protocol.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I don't even know what the Protocol means.

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Neither do I, Miss. MED. SHOT вЂ” ANNA with Russian CR of her, and other members of the Patrol following, coming out of her door, into the corridor. Landlady in CR f.g. French soldier comes up behind Anna C and hands Anna her lipstick вЂ”

dialogues.text: LONG SHOT вЂ” MARTINS pacing about on the large main staircase of the Internati Police Headquarters. LONG SHOT вЂ” ANNA escorted by the International Patrol, entering the main h Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  of the Police Headquarters. CLOSEUP вЂ” MARTINS looking off R, reacting to hearing Anna approach. He move to exit вЂ”- MED. SHOT вЂ” ANNA coming up the stairs with an MP either side of her.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: Anna, what's happened to you? LONG вЂ” HIGH ANGLE SHOT вЂ” ANNA with escort, coming up the stairs RL toward Martins, on first landing. He runs up after them. M.P. All right, all right, keep out of this.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: Listen, I've got to talk to you. I've just seen a dead man walk. MED. SHOT вЂ” ANNA with her escort, including the Russian soldier, coming in picture, upstairs LR in R profile. Martins runs after the M.P. All right chum, get back.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: I saw him buried! The M.P.'s push him away. M.P. Cut it out... CLOSE SHOT вЂ” ANNA and her escorts crossing screen LR up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: And now I've seen him alive. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” CALLOWAY Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca comes out of door, holding some documents. He walks forw and stops looking off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from HIGH ANGLE down to first floor of Headquarters. Anna and her escort coming up to top of stairs LR - Calloway standing outside door of his office CR of picture.

dialogues.speaker: CALLOWAY
dialogues.text: Just a minute. Bring her in here. You stay out here. He goes through the door, and Anna and the Patrol follow. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” CALLOWAY going into the door of his office, followed by Anna, a member of the patrol just behind.

dialogues.speaker: CALLOWAY
dialogues.text: Come in, Miss Schmidt. He closes door, leaving the patrol outside, seen through glass window to the corridor beyond. He closes door and crosses in front of her RL, CAMERA PANNING with him, Anna following, and we SHOOT PAST him in L f.g. to Anna.

dialogues.speaker: CALLOWAY
dialogues.text: Now then, Miss Schmidt, I'm not interested in your forged papers - that's purely a Russian case. When did you last see Lime?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Two weeks ago. He steps to her.

dialogues.speaker: CALLOWAY
dialogues.text: I want the truth, Miss Schmidt. We know he is alive.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: It's true then? He crosses in front of her LR, CAMERA PANNING with him - stops in R f.g.

dialogues.speaker: CALLOWAY
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Joseph Harbin's body was found in the coffin.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: What did you say? I'm sorry... He crosses in front of her again RL, CAMERA PANNING - and stands in L f.g.

dialogues.speaker: CALLOWAY
dialogues.text: I said another man was buried in his place.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Where's Harry?

dialogues.speaker: CALLOWAY
dialogues.text: That's what we want to find out.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry - I don't seem able to understand anything you say. He's alive now this minute - he's doing something.

dialogues.speaker: CALLOWAY
dialogues.text: Miss Schmidt, we know he is somewhere across the canal in the Russian sector... You may as well help us. In a few minutes Colonel Brodsky will be questioning you about your papers. Tell me where Lime is.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: CALLOWAY
dialogues.text: If you help me, I am prepared to help you.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Martins always said you were a fool... He crosses in front of her LR, CAMERA PANNING to door and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: CALLOWAY
dialogues.text: Vienna is a closed city, Miss Schmidt, he can't get away.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Poor Harry, I wish he was dead, he would be safe from all of you then. She goes through door.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: LONG SHOT вЂ” MARTINS walking down cobbled street, toward Kurtz' house in L f.g Rubble in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from ground level, Kurtz looking down over the balcony to doorway below.

dialogues.speaker: KURTZ
dialogues.text: Why that's you! LONG SHOT вЂ” MARTINS standing in front of the house, looking up off L in L profile for Kurtz.

dialogues.speaker: KURTZ, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: Come up! LONG SHOT вЂ” KURTZ on the balcony. He calls off into the room behind him.

dialogues.speaker: KURTZ
dialogues.text: Winkel, look who's here! MED. SHOT вЂ” MARTINS in the street, looking up off L for Kurtz on the balcony. Tram crossing in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: I want to speak to you, Kurtz.

dialogues.speaker: KURTZ, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: Of course...come up.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: I'll wait here. LONG SHOT вЂ” KURTZ with Winkel now CR of him, looking down off CR for Martin Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. MED. SHOT вЂ” MARTINS in street, looking up off CL for Kurtz and Winkel.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: I want to talk to Harry. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” KURTZ AND WINKEL on the balcony, looking down off R for Martins.

dialogues.speaker: KURTZ
dialogues.text: Are you mad?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: All right - I'm mad. I've seen a ghost... MED. SHOT -вЂ” MARTINS looking up, off CL for Kurtz.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: You tell Harry I want to see him. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” KURTZ AND WINKEL looking down off CR for Martins.

dialogues.speaker: KURTZ
dialogues.text: Be reasonable - come up and talk. MED. SHOT вЂ” MARTINS with the big wheel in b.g. He moves away upstage, pointin to the wheel and calling back.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: No thank you - I like the open. Tell him I'll wait by that wheel there...Or do ghosts only ride by night, Dr. Winkel? Got an opinion on that? CLOSE SHOT вЂ” KURTZ AND WINKEL on the balcony, looking down off R for Martins. They turn Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  away. Music starts.

LONG SHOT вЂ” MERRY-вЂ”GO-ROUND It is still and nobody near it. LONG SHOT вЂ” MARTINS standing CR of the "Chairoplane" stand, the big wheel beh him in b.g. He walks forward into MED. SHOT вЂ” HARRY walks downstage to Martins in R f.g. He walks round him a stops in L profile R f.g., facing Martins.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hello, old man. How are you? Fair attendant passes in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: Hello, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, well, they seem to've been giving you quite some busy time. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: I want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Talk to me?...Of course...Come on... LONG SHOT вЂ” SHOOTING UP through the structure of the big wheel from ground level CAMERA PANS UP slightly. MED. SHOT вЂ” HARRY taking off his coat, enters from CR, followed by Martins. The girl attendant of the wheel enters b.g. CL.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Kids used to ride this thing a lot in the old days. They haven't got the money nowadays, poor little devils. Harry gets the tickets from her.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Zwei steck.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Geht in ordung. They enter the carriage of the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Vielen danke. MED. SHOT вЂ” MARTINS enters carriage RL, followed by Harry. Girl attendant clo the door and starts the wheel in motion.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: Listen, Harry - I didn't believe that...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  It's good to see you, Holly. CLOSEUP вЂ” MARTINS in R profile, looking off L for Harry.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: I was at your funeral. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” HARRY looking off L for Martins - the wheel is turning - ground seen through window in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It was pretty smart, wasn't it? Oh, the same old indigestion. (takes a tablet) Holly...these are the only things that help - these tablets. These are the last. Can't get them anywhere in Europe any more. CLOSEUP вЂ” MARTINS in R profile, looking off CL for Harry.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: Do you know what's happened to your girl? CLOSE SHOT вЂ” HARRY in L profile - window in b.g. - and Vienna far below. He looks off R for Martins.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hmm.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: She's been arrested.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Tough...tough...Don't worry, old man, they won't hurt her. CLOSEUP вЂ” MARTINS looking off CR for Harry.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  They are handing her over to the Russians. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” HARRY looking off CL for Martins - ground seen through window i

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What can I do, old man, I'm dead, aren't I?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: You can help her.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Holly... He exits past CL. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” MARTINS Harry enters from CR to him and stands in L profile, look out of the window, then at him, as he stops in front of h

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: .В»..exactly who did you tell about me? Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: I told the police. CLOSEUP вЂ” HARRY past Martins in L f.g. He is in L profile, looking out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Unwise, Holly...

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: And - Anna...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Did the police believe you?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: You don't care anything at all about Anna, do you? He laughs. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've got quite a lot on my mind.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: You wouldn't do anything. Harry looks at Martins.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: (overlap) You can get somebody else...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Do you expect me to give myself up?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It's far better thing that I do... Holly, you and I aren't heroes, the world doesn't make any heroes...

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: You've got plenty of contacts.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Outside of your stories...I've got to be careful. He turns away to exit CR. MED. SHOT -вЂ” HARRY enters from CL and stands, in R profile, near the window.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I'm only safe in the Russian Zone... I'm safe as long as they can use me...

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: As long as they can use you?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I wish I could get rid of this thing. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” MARTINS Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  looking off CR for Harry.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: Oh, so that's how they found out about Anna... CLOSE SHOT вЂ” MARTINS entering from CL to Harry, standing by the window of the carriage. CAMERA PANS LR slightly as he walks to and fro front of Harry.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: You told them, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Don't try to be a policeman, old man.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: What did you expect me to be - part of your... He crosses LR.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Part? You can have any part you want, so long as you don't interfere...I have never cut you out of anything yet.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: I remember when they raided the gambling joint - you know a safe way out...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sure... CLOSEUP вЂ” MARTINS in L profile. Sound of wheel over scene.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: Yes, safe for you...not safe for me. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” HARRY Martins' head tipping L edge of frame вЂ”

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Old man - you never should have Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  gone to the police. You know you ought to leave this thing alone. Martins turns his head so that we SHOOT PAST him R profil in L f.g.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: Have you ever seen any of your victims?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Do you know, I don't ever feel comfortable on these sort of things...Victims? He opens the door of the carriage.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Don't be melodramatic. MED. SHOT вЂ” MARTINS in L f.g., Harry opening door in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Look down there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from Martins' eye line of the fair ground far below and t people now on it.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Would you feel any pity if one of those dots stopped moving forever? CLOSE SHOT вЂ” HARRY looking off CL for Martins.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: If I offered you ,20,000 for every dot that stopped - would you really, old man, tell me to keep my money? Or would you calculate how many dots you could afford to spare?...Free of Income Tax, old man... CLOSE SHOT вЂ” MARTINS Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  looking off CR for Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: ...free of Income Tax. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” HARRY looking off CL for Martins. Sound of wheel over scene.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It's the only way to save money nowadays. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” MARTINS looking off CR for Harry. He moves forward.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: Lot of good your money will do you in jail. Exits CR. MED. LONG SHOT вЂ” HARRY standing CR of the open window. Martins enters from CL.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That jail is in another zone... CLOSE SHOT вЂ” HARRY over Martins' R shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: There's no proof against me, beside you. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” MARTINS looking down CR, Harry tipping R edge of frame. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” HARRY over Martins' R shoulder. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” MARTINS over Harry's L shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  I should be pretty easy to get rid of. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” HARRY over Martins' R shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Pretty easy... CLOSE SHOT вЂ” MARTINS over Harry's L shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: I wouldn't be too sure. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” HARRY over Martins' R shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I carry a gun...I don't think they'd look for a bullet wound after you'd hit that ground... CLOSE SHOT вЂ” MARTINS over Harry's L shoulder. Sound of wheel over.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: They have dug up your coffin. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” HARRY over Martins' R shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: And found Harbin? Hmm, pity. MED. SHOT вЂ” MARTINS CL вЂ” Harry turning back in R f.g. to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh, Holly, what fools we are, talking to each other this way... As though I would do anything to you - or you to me. Harry moves upstage to Martins, CAMERA TRACKS IN with him and Martins exits CL. Harry closes the door of the carria Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just a little mixed up about things. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” MARTINS sits down into position at the side of the carriage, look thoughtfully off R.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ..in general. Nobody thinks in terms... CLOSE SHOT вЂ” HARRY walks downstage RL, CAMERA TRACKS BACK with him - and he stops in CLOSEUP, looking off L for Martins.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: ...of human beings. Governments don't, so why should we? They talk about the people, and the Proletariat... I talk about the suckers and the mugs... (walks away upstage to M.C.S. at window) It's the same thing. They have their five-year plan, and so have I. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” MARTINS seated, looking off R - the window behind him.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: You used to believe in God. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” HARRY at window, looking back over his shoulder off L for Marti

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I still do believe in God, old man... I believe in God and Mercy and all that... The dead are happier dead. They don't miss much here... CAMERA PANS RL with him as he moves slightly still, looki off L, and starts to idly write on the window at his side out of picture. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  CLOSE SHOT вЂ” THE WINDOW Wheel turning over scene. Harry's hand in picture from CR he has drawn on the steamed-up window a heart with an arr through it. He is writing the word ANNA above it.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ...poor devils. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” MARTINS looking off R, reacting to the heart on the window pane. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” HARRY at the window, looking off L for Martins.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What do you believe in? He exits CR. Wheel noise stops. MED. SHOT -вЂ” HARRY walking to window LR. Martins enters from L f.g., moving to his side. We see they are now on ground level, through the window.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, if you ever get Anna out of this mess, be kind to her. He opens the door and Martins starts to go through.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You'll find she's worth it. MED. SHOT вЂ” MARTINS coming out of the carriage of the big wheel, followed by Harry. CAMERA TRACKS BACK with them and stops as they sto in CS in f.g. - Martins CL.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I wish I had asked you to bring me some of these tablets from home... Holly, I would like to cut you in, old man. Nobody left in Vienna I can really trust - and we have always done everything together. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  When you make up your mind, send me a message... I'll meet you any place, any time. And when we do meet, old man, it is you I want to see, not the police. Remember that, won't you?... Martin moves away LR, CAMERA PANNING with him вЂ”- but Ha back up and bars his way on the steps. Music starts.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Don't be so gloomy...After all, it's not that awful. Remember what the fellow said... He backs a little down the steps in CS and CAMERA PANS LR with him, losing Martins.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: вЂ” in Italy, for thirty years under the Borgias, they had warfare, terror, murder, bloodshed, but they produced Michaelangelo - Leonardo Da Vinci, and the Renaissance...In Switzerland, they had brotherly love. They had five hundred years of democracy and peace, and what did that produce?...The cuckoo clock. So long, Holly. He exits quickly CR. CLOSEUP вЂ” MARTINS leaning on the rail, looking down thoughtfully. LONG SHOT вЂ” MERRY-вЂ”GO-ROUND -вЂ” a small boy going round on it. Harry enters from CR looks back вЂ”- then continues on upstage, toward the mer round. Music stops.

dialogues.speaker: CALLOWAY
dialogues.text: Look here, Martins. You can always Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  arrange to meet him at some cafe here in the International zone. dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: It wouldn't work.

dialogues.speaker: CALLOWAY
dialogues.text: We'll never get him in the Russian zone.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: Calloway, you expect too much. I know he deserves to hang, you proved your stuff. But twenty years is a long time - don't ask me to tie the rope. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” CALLOWAY looking off R for Martins, CAMERA PANS LR with him as he moves away.

dialogues.speaker: CALLOWAY
dialogues.text: Okay, forget it. MED. SHOT вЂ” RUSSIAN OFFICER comes through door (sound of door opening) - looks off R Calloway.

dialogues.speaker: BRODSKY
dialogues.text: Busy, Major? CLOSE SHOT вЂ” CALLOWAY looking off CL for Russian.

dialogues.speaker: CALLOWAY
dialogues.text: What is it, Brodsky? MED. SHOT вЂ” RUSSIAN holding file, looking off R for Calloway. He walks forwar to CS and hands file off R to Calloway.

dialogues.speaker: BRODSKY
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  We have identified the girl. Here is her...report. Music starts. MED. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” CALLOWAY past Russian in L f.g., Calloway looking at file. He puts passport down on desk. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” PASSPORT falling onto desk as Calloway puts it down.

dialogues.speaker: CALLOWAY
dialogues.text: I've questioned her - we've... CLOSEUP вЂ” MARTINS looking down off CR at the passport on the table.

dialogues.speaker: CALLOWAY
dialogues.text: -..got nothing against her.

dialogues.speaker: BRODSKY
dialogues.text: We shall... CLOSE SHOT вЂ” RUSSIAN OFFICER looking off R for Calloway.

dialogues.speaker: BRODSKY
dialogues.text: ...apply for her at the Four Power Meeting tomorrow. She has no right to be here. CLOSEUP вЂ” MARTINS looking down off R at the passport. CLOSE SHOT вЂ”- ANNA'S PASSPORT lying on Calloway's desk. MED. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” CALLOWAY past Russian in L f.g.

dialogues.text: I've asked your people to help with Lime. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.text: That's...

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN
dialogues.text: looking off R for Calloway.

dialogues.speaker: BRODSKY
dialogues.text: ...a different case. It's being looked into. So long. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” MARTINS looking down. He walks away upstage RL, CAMERA PANNING wi him.

dialogues.speaker: BRODSKY
dialogues.text: ...-Major.

dialogues.speaker: CALLOWAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: In the last war, a General would hang his opponent's picture on the wall... CLOSE SHOT вЂ” CALLOWAY seated at desk.

dialogues.speaker: CALLOWAY
dialogues.text: He got to know him that way. CLOSEUP вЂ” BACK OF MARTINS' HEAD favoring his L profile. He turns around to look off for Calloway.

dialogues.speaker: CALLOWAY
dialogues.text: I think this would have worked with your help. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” HARRY'S OPEN FILE with two photographs. PAN RL to Anna's passport. CLOSEUP вЂ” MARTINS in L profile, looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: What price would you pay? Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  CLOSEUP вЂ” CALLOWAY looking off R for Martins.

dialogues.speaker: CALLOWAY
dialogues.text: Name it.

dialogues.text: I don't... CLOSE SHOT вЂ” ANNA in corner of compartment, looking at passport.

dialogues.text: .В».-understand Major Calloway. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.text: Why has he done all this? MED. CLOSE SHOT вЂ”- PAINE reaching up to luggage rack - CAMERA TILTED.

dialogues.text: through door of buffet. Anna enters, CAMERA TRACKING AND PANNING RL with her and revealing Martins seated at bar. looks up.

dialogues.text: Oh... MED. SHOT вЂ” ANNA past Martins in L f.g.

dialogues.text: See me off? From here? Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  MED. SHOT -вЂ” MARTINS looking for Anna.

dialogues.text: Oh, I watched you on the train. No harm in that. MED. SHOT вЂ” ANNA looking off L for Martins.

dialogues.text: How did you know I would be here? MED. SHOT вЂ” MARTINS looking off R for Anna.

dialogues.text: I heard something about it at Police... MED. SHOT вЂ” ANNA at door вЂ” she walks forward CL.

dialogues.text: I'm sorry. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” MARTINS past Anna in R f.g. He reacts to station announcer in b.g

dialogues.text: What is on your mind? Why did you hide?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I shall be all right.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: You send me a wire as soon as you arrive. They exit through door CR. CAMERA TRACKS RL to shoot thro Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  buffet window, past Anna to Martins.

dialogues.text: What is going to happen? Where is Harry?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: He's safe in the Russian zone.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: I saw him today. MED. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” ANNA looking off L for Martins - door of the buffet behind her

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: How is he? MED. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” MARTINS opening outer door to let Anna out.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: He can look after himself, don't worry. MED. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” ANNA looking off CL for Martins, who enters from CL to her R side, to hurry her out. CAMERA TRACKS IN as she moves bac against inner door away from him, and WE SHOOT over his R shoulder to her.

dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Of course I didn't tell Calloway.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: That's his headache.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: His.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: Oh, well.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Why are you lying?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: We're getting you out of here, aren't we? CLOSE SHOT-вЂ” ANNA looking off L for Martins.

dialogues.text: You have seen Calloway. What are you two doing? CLOSE SHOT вЂ” MARTINS Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  over Anna's L shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: Well, they asked me to help take him, and I'm helping. CLOSEUP вЂ” ANNA looking off L for Martins. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” MARTINS over Anna's L shoulder. He turns away to exit CL. CLOSEUP вЂ” ANNA looking down CR.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Poor Harry. MED. SHOT вЂ” MARTINS by tables in buffet, bapk to camera.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINS
dialogues.text: Poor Harry? CLOSEUP вЂ” ANNA looking down CR. MED. SHOT -вЂ” MARTINS standing by tables, looking off CL for Anna.

dialogues.text: Poor Harry! Wouldn't even lift a finger to help you. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” ANNA looking off CR for Martins.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Oh, you've got your precious honesty and don't want anything else. MED. SHOT вЂ” MARTINS Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  looks off CL for Anna, then turns away.

dialogues.text: You still want him. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” ANNA in front of coffee bar, looking off CR for Martins. Sound train whistle.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I don't want him any more. I don't want to see him or hear him, but he is still part of me, that's a fact. I couldn't do a thing to harm him. dialogues.text: Oh, Anna, why do we always have to... CLOSE SHOT вЂ” ANNA looking ahead of her. She tears her passport in two. Mart Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  enters from CR and leans on bar in b.g.

dialogues.text: ...quarrel?

dialogues.text: A girl of spirit.

dialogues.text: That will be a fine boast to make. Well, I always wanted you to catch that plane. MED. CLOSE SHOT вЂ” MARTINS Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  looking off R for Calloway.
